devfestahm17-summary.brief: GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017 is now over. It was a great success. We are happy to share with you some facts, emotions and, of course, photos from the biggest Google Developers Conference in Gujarat!
devfestahm17-summary.content: <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_1.png" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  [GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017](http://devfest17.gdgahmedabad.com/) is now over. It was a great success. We are happy to share with you some facts, emotions and, of course, photos from the biggest Google Developers Conference in Gujarat!  - On behalf of the GDG Ahmedabad‚Äôs Team we warmly thank you for helping make [GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017](http://devfest17.gdgahmedabad.com/) a huge success.  - A BIG THANK to all the volunteers from different GDG groups of Gujarat for their priceless help,  thanks to all the speakers for the great speeches and sharing their experience and knowledge, and, of course, thanks to all our partners, specially, [Nath Films](https://www.facebook.com/NathFilm/) for being supporting partner.  The event took place on 05th of November at the [Gujarat University Convention and Exhibition Centre](http://gucec.com/). DevFest was focused on Mobile and Web technologies and also Community Hub. Over 600 people participated in the event with a mix of students and working professionals (more 80% experienced developers).  **These one day were full of discoveries and records:**  The biggest amount of visitors of all annual Gujarat devfests - 600+ visitors, 2 parallel tracks of Mobile and Web technologies and also community hub, 15+ sessions by our Rockstar speakers. No marketing - just technical hardcore!  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_2.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üé§ The widest geography of our [speakers](http://devfest17.gdgahmedabad.com/speakers) - Ahmedabad, Baroda, Delhi, Banglore, Pune.  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_3.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üè¨ A HUGE venue design  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_4.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üì± Kotlin and Android sessions were the most popular sessions during the conference part of the event.  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_5.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  ü§πüèª‚Äç Attendees never bored, During Keynote session let's have some fun  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_6.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üì° Those Who was at home, they was also able to join and enjoy [GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017](http://devfest17.gdgahmedabad.com/) through our YouTube channel by watching all recorded session from [GDG Ahmedabad DevFest 2017 playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCrXLkoWFdiqEnRZyVlOQsT1FzTi-kba7).  <iframe width="100%" height="500" align="middle" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7CNlOwQ3V1Q" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>  üìΩ For the very first time, We have recorded event in 360 camera brought to you by [Vrizm Innovations Pvt Ltd](https://www.vrizm.com/). Let's have a look on some movements in 360 view.  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_7.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  ü§ù üôå üëè And, of course, the VOLUNTEERS  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/summary2017_8.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  As you could see, the most wonderful part was atmosphere - full of networking, geeks, inventors, speakers, visitors, presenters and rocking on Twitter through thousand of tweets :).  Thank you all!! You are awesome! Keep in touch with us! Cheers! ;)   üôè The entire [GDG Ahmedabad TEAM](http://devfest.gdgahmedabad.com/team)
devfestahm17-summary.title: GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017 - SUMMARY

thank-you.brief: Our team wants to thank one more time our partners, who made GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017 possible...
thank-you.content: We want to thank one more time our partners, who made [GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017](http://devfest17.gdgahmedabad.com/) possible! THANK YOU for being creative and motivating our participants for new challenges, THANK YOU for your experiments and expertise during the insane 1 days of GDG DevFest Ahmedabad. We want to highlight the most interesting and catching moments that made our conference so special:  - Our general partner and our source of inspiration, [Google](https://www.google.com.ua/intl/en/about/)  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/thankyou_1.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üéÅ [Simform](https://www.simform.co.in/), our Supporting Partners, memento for speakers with magnifical surprise  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/thankyou_2.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üì∑ üé• Photography and Videography support from [Nath Films](https://www.facebook.com/NathFilm/).  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/thankyou_3.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  üåè Thanks to [Vrizm Innovations](https://www.vrizm.com/) for recording event in 360 camera.  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/thankyou_4.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>  Again, THANK YOU all, you are amazing! Hope you to join us next year!  ‚ù§Ô∏è With love, GDG DevFest Ahmedabad Team  <plastic-image srcset="/images/posts/thankyou_5.jpg" lazy-load preload fade></plastic-image>
thank-you.title: Thank you all for your support

devfestahm18-announced.brief: It is official. GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2018 is going to take place in Ahmedabad, November 25.
devfestahm18-announced.content:
Mark your dates for the biggest developer conclave of the city as **DevFest Ahmedabad 2018** is here on November 25, 2018.
[Google Developers Group Ahmedabad (GDG Ahmedabad)](https://www.gdgahmedabad.com/) is for the developers, interested in Google's developer technology from Android to App Engine, Google Chrome platforms to product APIs like the Maps, YouTube, Flutter and Tensorflow, all that Google you can think of. GDG Ahmedabad is back with its annual gathering of technology enthusiasts working on Android, Web and Cloud technologies for a day full of sessions, workshops, showcases, networking with other like-minded industry colleagues and ample fun. This year, we expect over **450+ engineers, managers, and entrepreneurs** come to DevFest to learn about Android, Web and Cloud technologies, and to experience the phenomenal atmosphere.

Come and join us at [#DevFestAhm](https://twitter.com/search?q=DevFestAhm) 2018 to witness the best of tech, explore and learn about Flutter, Kotlin, Machine Learning, Tensorflow, Google Cloud, Blockchain, Firebase, AngularJS, ARCore, Actions on Google etc. and experience the magnificent atmosphere with tech all around you.
Tickets - Declare soon

## Stay in Touch!
We would love to see you at #DevFestAhm 2018. **Subscribe to DevFest newsletter** or follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GDGAhmedabad/), [Twitter](https://twitter.com/GDGAhmedabad/) not to miss any of our announcements and conference updates. We can't wait to meet you in Ahmedabad, the rising tech capital of Gujarat.
GDG DevFest Ahmedabad Team.
devfestahm18-announced.title: Announcing GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2018

c4p.brief: GDG DevFest Ahmedabad was announced, for the sixth year in a row, the conference will bring together 450+ developers, managers and...
c4p.content:
We are back to rock our 6th DevFest season. Yeah! you have heard it right, we had hosted our very **1st DevFest** event back in year 2012. Before going ahead, we want you to check out how was the last year DevFest Ahmedabad event, which would help you in realising the level of quality, knowledge and impact that we are expecting from each speakers.



GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2018 has been announced! The 6th edition of the biggest conference about Google technologies in Ahmedabad will take place on **25th November 2018** in an ancient city of Gujarat.
That means that it is time to open Call For Speaker form. If you are passionate about your work and want to share your experience with the biggest tech audience in Ahmedabad, you knocked on the right door.

**Last year DevFest broke all expectations** of the audience, speakers, and even our ones. With **92% of satisfied attendees**, we can claim that GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2017 was a great success.

To keep up this year, we decided to focus on the content. **We‚Äôre looking for speakers like you**, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field.
Submit a proposal

### Why is it cool to be a speaker?
Well, do you know a better way to attend the conference? Here are our top 3 reasons to submit a proposal.
1Ô∏è‚É£ **It is good for your career.** By being a speaker, you are proving your level of expertise to a potential business partners or employers.
2Ô∏è‚É£ **It is good for the company you‚Äôre working for.** Any presentation delivered by an employee adds credibility to a company‚Äôs public image.
3Ô∏è‚É£ **Unique networking.** Being a speaker means you‚Äôll have unique chance to network with other speakers - the best experts in the industry.

### Themes and topics ‚Äì what do we expect?
Our team prepared set of interesting topics in but if you have any great presentation or idea related to Google technologies, feel free to submit your talk as well.

### Mobile
‚ñ´Ô∏è Flutter
‚ñ´Ô∏è Kotlin
‚ñ´Ô∏è UI/UX
‚ñ´Ô∏è Action on Google
‚ñ´Ô∏è Wear
‚ñ´Ô∏è TV
‚ñ´Ô∏è Best Practices
‚ñ´Ô∏è Performance Optimisations
‚ñ´Ô∏è Firebase
‚ñ´Ô∏è RxJava
‚ñ´Ô∏è Data Binding
‚ñ´Ô∏è Testing
‚ñ´Ô∏è Architecture best practices

### Gaming & VR/AR
‚ñ´Ô∏è Daydream
‚ñ´Ô∏è ARCore
‚ñ´Ô∏è Project Tango
‚ñ´Ô∏è Unity
‚ñ´Ô∏è Unreal
‚ñ´Ô∏è Google Play Game Services

### Web
‚ñ´Ô∏è Machine Learning/AI
‚ñ´Ô∏è TensorFlow
‚ñ´Ô∏è Kubernetes
‚ñ´Ô∏è Docker
‚ñ´Ô∏è Angular 2
‚ñ´Ô∏è Vision API
‚ñ´Ô∏è Speech API
‚ñ´Ô∏è Progressive Web App
‚ñ´Ô∏è Laravel
‚ñ´Ô∏è Polymer
‚ñ´Ô∏è React Native
‚ñ´Ô∏è any Google web tech or open source tech

**Call for Speakers will stay open until October 23, 2018.** Don‚Äôt miss out :)

Submit a proposal

**Please note:** There is no guarantee that a submission will be put onto the conference agenda! The program committee picks the most interesting talk proposals and informs the selected submitters until October 23, 2018.

Any questions? Email organizer at [pareshmayani@gmail.com](mailto:pareshmayani@gmail.com)
c4p.title: We're looking for speakers

101.description: Accessibility is integral part of the web and products. By default, web is accessible but we developer mess with the code. This talk will tell devs what, how and where to do make your code accessible.
101.title: Web for all - Accessibility

102.description: The talk discusses few design and fairness principles to keep in mind while building solutions augmented with ML as a core engine with examples around the world.
102.title: A discussion on design and fairness in the world of ML

103.description: The client-server architecture was invented in the 1960s and the majority of modern mobile and web applications are based on this architecture. As the technology evolved since the inception of the internet, so did the reasons for applying client-server architecture in web and mobile application design. The server consists of server code, the secrets, raw computing resources, and OS. Both server code and the secrets are data. They can be serialized together into one bundle, and cryptographically protected from tampering and disclosure. In this talk, I will talk about the best way of creating your own serverless APIs using Google Cloud and what are the other available options. Writing serverless code is easy, free and secure. Let‚Äôs create our own serverless.
103.title: Serverless API creation and deployment using Google Cloud

104.description:
Slower Web Apps

They will learn
- Basics of WebApp Optimization
- How to Use Lighthouse from Chrome to find issues with their web app.
- How to fix these issues.
104.title: Lighthouse for Chrome: Find your way to faster Web Apps.

105.description: We as developers sometimes become completely negligent about, how revenue will come from the app which we are developing. Revenue will only come if your mobile app is habbit forming. It sticks with the user and becomes his habit.
105.title: Designing Addictive Web Apps

106.description:
The talk will be 45:00 minutes. It is a collection of the best possible recent developments made in Android. It covers the most recent enhancements made in Android for developers. It will includes the overview and detailed information about new things in:

1. AndroidX the Support Library.
2. New in Android Testing (Espresso and JUnit)
3. Android App Bundles.
4. RTT Api for inside the building location.
5. Enterprise Apps
6. Slices
7. Deep Linking
8. Notifications( inline images and Smart Reply)
9. Android Studio profiler.
10. Layout Inspector
106.title: New way of doing things in Android

107.description:
Working with asynchronous code is difficult especially for Android Developers which ultimately leads to callback hell.

Everyone is talking about Co-routines these days, but how can you really use them to their full potential?
Well, In this talk, we will look at Kotlin co-routines which truly make it easier for developers to handle concurrency in their applications with a gentle learning curve, solution to handle cancellation, error handling, testing and write least boilerplate code.

This talk would cover:
- Co-routines Generator API Example (for explaining suspension)
- How and where to create Coroutine Scopes, and how to manage them
- Create a Notes App with all functionalities including API calls just by using co-routines and Kotlin URL extension functions
- Also how to use co-routines with popular REST client Retrofit.
107.title: Efficient Async with Kotlin Coroutines

108.description: Firebase MLKit was introduced in Google I/O 2018. It comes as a part of Firebase suite. It combines capabilities of Google Cloud Vision API, TensorFlow Lite, Neural Network API in single SDK. This allows mobile app developers to use ML models in their apps. It also comes with predefined APIs using which mobile app developers can implement functionalities like image labeling, face detection, barcode scanning etc. in the apps. In this session we will cover basics of ML Kit first. This will show how mobile app developers can use the SDK in their  android project. After this we will explore all the base APIs of SDK with demos. We will have quick demo to demonstrate capabilities of the each APIs. Also we will see how we can embed ML models in the apps by using the SDK with practical demo.
108.title: Exploring Firebase MLKit on Android

109.description: Android is one of the topmost Mobile Operating System used across the globe. It is apparently clear that lot of new applications are being developed on daily basis. However, 95% of the apps are found to be insecure.
109.title: Android Application Security Testing

110.description: Flutter uses reactive views, which you can take to the next level by applying reactive principles with BLoC and ScopedModel patterns to your app‚Äôs data model.
110.title: How to build Reactive Architecture for Flutter.

113.description:
Actions on Google is a developer platform that lets you create software to extend the functionality of the Google Assistant.
There are three levels of codelabs which includes level_1, level_2, and level_3 that we‚Äôre going to cover. At last, you‚Äôll be able to develop an rich interactive application by yourself.
113.title: Codelab - Actions on Google

114.description:
Predicting tomorrow today for everything in tech
Celebrate diversity
Fintech, Regtech and FutureTech
Mobile, Mobility and Mesh
Autonomous, Automated and Augmented
114.title: Keynote 1

132.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around
132.title: Registration & morning Coffee

karthik_padmanabhan.bio: Karthik Padmanabhan is the Developer Relations Program lead at Google and is responsible for India, Middle East and North Africa regions. Karthik has been with the tech industry for almost three decades in the areas of product management, business development, tech evangelism, etc. He leads a team that focuses on enabling developer communities to adopt Google & open source technologies like TensorFlow, PWA, Android, & Google Cloud for the Next Billion Users (NBU). Karthik is a seeker, plays Golf, works at Google's Bangalore office and lives on a farm that functions on sustainable living practices.

paresh_mayani.bio:
Paresh Mayani is a full time mobile application developer having 8 years of experience in app development. He has been working on android application development since Cupcake(Android 1.5). Over the span of period, he has worked on many challenging mobile projects in different domains like Automobile, e-commerce and health care.

He is an avid Open source enthusiast, who has been organizing events as well as blogging, speaking and mentoring on Android related topics since 2010. He can be frequently found giving talks on various topics ranging from android development best practices, android UI/UX, android testing and Android BLE at Domestic & International conferences such as Android Developer Days Turkey (Droidcon Ankara), DevFest Kathmandu, GDG DevCamp and NitroDroid.

He has been actively supporting his fellow android developers through various online and offline means. His has published more than 150 articles on his blog TechnoTalkative on which he writes about various technical solutions for Android Development. He holds 95000+ reputation on StackOverflow , where he is also in 10 highest reputation holders for Android tag.

He is also been nominated for the Google Developers Expert for Android program. Recently he was invited to attend the Google IO 2016 event at Mountain View, California.

Currently he is working as a Practice Head at Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd. He is also been a mentor for start-ups having android apps. He is a founder/organizer of Google Developers Group Ahmedabad , one of the senior most organiser in India.

He has done Masters in Computer Engineering in Wireless and Mobile Computing. Being an expert, he has an excellent command over developing applications that has made him a good trainer as well as an avid speaker in his domain. He often organises workshops, seminars and talks to help developers & students who look forward to grow their careers in the field of Mobile Computing.

smit_shah.bio:
Smit Shah is Co-Founder & CEO of eSecurify Technologies. He is a Certified Ethical Hacker. He has constantly been engaged in conducting workshops and bootcamps for corporate houses and academic institutions such as IIT's, NIT's, BITS Pilani, Sinhgadh University, SRM University and many more. He has also trained more than 6000 students.

He has a wide experience in the field of Web & Mobile Application Vulnerability Assessment & Penetration Testing. Smit has reported a loophole on PayPal. PayPal is widely used for online overseas payment transfer. Apart from this, his recent research includes a 0 day Vulnerability on edX-Platform. edX is an open source online course launcher application.

A Certified Ethical Hacker has also found vulnerabilities in Barracuda Networks, Secunia, SANS, WebSecurify, Scanmyserver and many other IT Security Giants giants. He recently reported a critical flaw to Mobikwik Wallet App.

He has also been invited as a Guest Speaker in many Live Talk Shows on current affairs related to Cyber World like Cyber Attack on Pakistani Websites after Pathankot Attack, Whatsapp Hacking, Facebook Hacking, Credit & Debit Card Frauds, Email Hacking, Computer Hacking and many more.

He has also cracked the toughest interview (a multi staged international interview process) of Synack and is now a proud Synack Red Team (SRT) Member.

nimesh_solanki.bio:
Nimesh is a 3rd-year UG student pursuing ICT engineering at PDPU Gandhinagar.

He's a tech enthusiast who's passionate about voice and web technologies. He's got a zest for coding, in particular for JavaScript. Has designed & developed voice application for virtual assistants like Google assistant and Amazon Alexa and looking forward to develop more in this domain, currently working on a research paper on BlockChain based Advanced Public Transport System.
nimesh_solanki.name: Nimesh Solanki

juhil_somaiya.bio:
A MAD guy - Motivated, Ambitious and Diligent.

He's Machine Learning explorer by heart and Python, Odoo developer by profession. He has worked as Google Applied CS with Android Facilitator. He is a part of Actions on Google Developers community and Coursera Data Science community. He is also a blogger, who's writing about Machine Learning at Data Driven Investor's Publication on Medium.

Introduction to Kotlin for Android App Development

utpal_betai.bio: Utpal has a flair for public speaking and beating drums for new technologies. He has aced the art of public speaking and engaging audience in a unique way. You can expect insight into future in his talks. He will take you for a ride full of surprises and emotions which every developer should be part of. So fasten your seat belts and enjoy the ride like every year at this year's Keynote.
utpal_betai.name: Utpal Betai
utpal_betai.title: Sr. Project Manager

manoranjan_padhy.bio: Manoranjan works on the Developer Communities Program in India along with managing the India specific social handle of Google Developers. Before working for Google, Manoranjan used to contribute closely to developer communities and other educational institutions in the western part of India in the process of growth and knowledge sharing. He is passionate about Machine Learning and assisting people build things using it. On the personal side Manoranjan loves travelling to different places and meeting people.
manoranjan_padhy.name: Manoranjan Padhy
manoranjan_padhy.title: Community Manager

paresh_mayani.bio: Paresh Mayani is a full time mobile application developer having 7 years of experience in app development. He has been working on android application development since Cupcake(Android 1.5). Over the span of period, he has worked on many challenging mobile projects in different domains like Automobile, e-commerce and health care. He is an avid Open source enthusiast, who has been organizing events as well as blogging, speaking and mentoring on Android related topics since 2010. He can be frequently found giving talks on various topics ranging from android development best practices, android UI/UX, android testing and Android BLE at Domestic & International conferences such as Android Developer Days Turkey (Droidcon Ankara), DevFest Kathmandu, GDG DevCamp and NitroDroid. He has been actively supporting his fellow android developers through various online and offline means. His has published more than 150 articles on his blog TechnoTalkative on which he writes about various technical solutions for Android Development. He holds 80000+ reputation on StackOverflow , where he is also in 10 highest reputation holders for Android tag. He is also been nominated for the Google Developers Expert for Android program. Recently he was invited to attend the Google IO 2016 event at Mountain View, California. Currently he is working as a Technical Lead - Android at Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd. He is also been a mentor for start-ups having android apps. He is a founder/organizer of Google Developers Group, Ahmedabad , one of the senior most organiser in India. **Previous talks** - DevFest Ahmedabad 2016 - DevFest Pune 2016 and DevFest Baroda 2016 - Android Developer Days 2016, Ankara, Turkey - Android Developer Days 2015, Ankara, Turkey - GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2015 - GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2014 - GDG DevFest Kathmandu - September 2013 - GDG DevFest Kathmandu - September 2013
paresh_mayani.name: Paresh Mayani

2014.title: Introduction to Android Wear & Wear UI Patterns

2015.title: Engineering Android apps for Performance & Quality

2017.title: Generating Efficient APK by Reducing Size & Improving Performance

paresh_mayani.title: Technical Lead

ravindra_kumar.bio: Ravindra is currently working as an Android Developer at Fueled. He is the Creator of AndroidStarters.com. Previously he has worked with Cleartrip as a Lead Android Developer. He likes to contribute to Open Source Projects. He is a huge fan of fancy android libraries where he reports bugs, fixes them and give the valuable feedbacks. He has been a speaker at DrodCon, TiCon and JSFoo previously.
ravindra_kumar.name: Ravindra Kumar
ravindra_kumar.title: Android Developer

shubham_pachori.bio: Shubham has been inquisitive curious mind since he has joined engineering and he is thankful to his mentor Mr. Karan Shah who gave him the right direction and guidance to become what he is today. He likes to develop products which impact human life at large scale, are data intensive problems and require out of box thinking. Being in field with the users who are going to use the product he develops gives him an unprecedented feeling of accomplishment.
shubham_pachori.name: Shubham Pachori
shubham_pachori.title: Principal Full stack engineer

hardik_trivedi.bio: Hardik is a computer program writer and work with Globant which is based in Pune. A self learned programmer. Hardik has extensively worked on Android and Java since 2010 and also immersed himself in Kotlin. He loves contributing back to the development community by spending time on stack overflow and writing tech blogs. He also mentors college students and professionals and companies who has keen interest in mobile app development. He is active as a GDG community speaker. He recently presented a talk in GDG Pune DevFest-2017. He is a co-author of an upcoming book 'Kotlin Blueprints'.
hardik_trivedi.name: Hardik Trivedi

2017.title: Introduction to kotlin for android app development

hardik_trivedi.title: Senior Android Developer

hardik_pithva.bio: Hardik is an experienced Frontend Engineer with a good history in the Information Technology and Services Industry. He is skilled in Agile Methodologies, Angular, Material Design and many other domains. He is also an open source contributor on Github. He do take workshops on Frontend stack as well as provide mentorship on Angular. Being a community over, he has also been a speaker at GDG Pune DevFest.
hardik_pithva.name: Hardik Pithva
hardik_pithva.title: Frontend Engineer

hiren_dave.bio: Hiren Dave is a software engineer, blogger and consultant with over 9 years of professional experience. He writes code in number of languages. Hiren has a passion for developing web apps, mobile apps and writing books and blog articles about programming. He has a solid experience of startups as he manages products for few startups. He is also passionate about researching and learning new technologies and trends.He has also authored a book Instant Sencha Touch, published by Packt. He is also a creator of Video Course ‚ÄúBeginning Laravel‚Äù for Packt.
hiren_dave.name: Hiren Dave
hiren_dave.title: CTO

parth_jansari.bio: Parth is a guy who is trying to grow up and do mature stuff but end up designing or making cool stuff. He has four years of experience in designing and a years experience in front end development. He uses angular as a front end framework and ionic as a hybrid app framework. Currently he is exploring flutter as he believes it can be a replacemet for ionic 2.
parth_jansari.name: Parth Jansari

2017.title: Fantastic Cross Platform apps with Flutter

parth_jansari.title: Software Engineer

chintan_soni.bio: Chintan Soni, a passionate Sr. Android Developer at Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd., has been exploring and strengthening his roots in Android Development since more than 4 years. Not only in Android, but also he has experience on various cross platform tools, Back-end and Web technologies. In his free time, he contributes to developer community at Github and Stackoverflow. A good Sniper in CounterStrike ;)
chintan_soni.name: Chintan Soni
chintan_soni.title: Sr. Android Developer

kapil_bakshi.bio:
Kapil Bakshi is a very passionate techie with an aim to embrace technology, imbibe every bit of it, transcend all the barriers and turn ideas into reality. His experience spans across edtech, fintech and logistics sectors where he has developed things from scratch taking them to a level where they have scaled drastically and have become a brand in their respective domains. 

He is currently working at BlackBuck which is redefining the logistics landscape of India, making it reliable and efficient. Kapil is playing an important role there to improve quality of all apps, doing optimisations and helping the company scale to go much beyond. 

Apart from Android, he has worked on Backend technologies as well and many times single-handedly built complex features which have proven to be very beneficial for business. 

In Android, his areas of interest include testing, architectural best practices and security. 

Kapil has also given talks on architectural best practices and testing and has been invited at International Conferences like Droidcon Beijing 2017 .
kapil_bakshi.name: Kapil Bakshi

2017.title: Production Level Test Driven Development and What's new

mehul_patel.bio: Mehul Patel is specialized in Information Technology and Services. He is passionate about what he gets involved in. He holds a Masters in Computers Science and has been working on Linux since 4 years. He is a Developer Tech by profession, An open source enthusiast, Linux geeky and a maker by heart. He believes in the thought saying 'Nothing is more fulfilling than being part of a team with similar interests'.
mehul_patel.name: Mehul Patel

akshar_patel.bio: CTO of Techniexe Infolabs. Forever on the quest for innovation and learning. An advocate of Static Typing, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration/Delivery and Serverless infrastructure. Also, there is no Cloud. It's just someone else's computer.
akshar_patel.name: Akshar Patel

2017.title: Why REST when you can GraphQL?

akshar_patel.title: CTO
